info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 08 at 1:33PM PST until January 10 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches for valley locations, and 4 to 8 inches for foothill locations. Winds gusting 40 to 50 mph. * WHERE...In California, Surprise Valley California. In Nevada, Northern Washoe County and Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commutes. Strong winds could cause damage to trees and power lines along with rapid decreases in visibility in areas of blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This event will be similar to the one observed this past Saturday. A snowband accompanying a cold front will bring quick, heavy snowfall in a short period. With this band expected to pass through during the peak school/work commute time, major travel disruptions are possible. Very cold temperatures behind the front may lead to flash freezes on roadways and prolonged hazardous travel conditions into the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
